info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Horry County through 445 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hammond, or 9 miles northwest of North Myrtle Beach Airport, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory Grove, Wampee, Hammond, Brooksville, Hand, Nixonville, Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach and Grand Strand Regional Medical Center. This includes the following highways... SC Highway 31 between mile markers 12 and 19, and between mile markers 23 and 24. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 12 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
